p: Respiratory complications were seen in 21.7% of patients (n = 20) with an overall mortality rate of 5.4% (n = 5). Fig 5 shows the respiratory morbidity in children following HAdV pneumonia. All children who died had disseminated disease. Only three patients (15.8%) in the severe group made a complete recovery. PIBO (n = 10, 52.6%) was the commonest respiratory complication in the severe group. Five patients in the severe group needed non-invasive home respiratory support (26.5%). However, even in the non-severe group, four (5.5%) developed PIBO, one (1.4%) pulmonary fibrosis and another four (5.5%) had recurrent wheeze. Table 4 shows the demographic and clinical characteristics of the children who died (n = 5) and those with respiratory complications (n = 20).
